name: Mobile Apps Malware Classification
abstract: The rapid proliferation of mobile applications has led to an increased risk of malware infections, posing significant threats to user privacy and data security. This paper presents a comprehensive approach to classify mobile applications as either benign or malicious using machine learning algorithms...
introduction: With the growing reliance on mobile applications for daily tasks, ensuring the security and privacy of user data has become crucial...
objectives: To develop a machine learning-based framework for classifying Android applications as benign or malware.
To evaluate the performance of different machine learning algorithms in detecting mobile malware.
To identify the most effective features and parameters that contribute to accurate malware classification.
To provide insights into the strengths and limitations of each algorithm in the context of mobile security.

steps: Data Collection and Preprocessing: Utilization of the Drebin dataset, preprocessing of data to handle missing values, normalize features, and split the dataset into training and testing sets.
Feature Selection: Analysis of the dataset to identify key features that contribute to accurate classification.

Model Implementation: Implementation of multiple machine learning algorithms such as Decision Tree Classifier, Support Vector Machine (SVM), Logistic Regression, K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN), and Sequential Neural Network.
Model Evaluation: Evaluation of models using metrics such as accuracy, precision, recall, and F1-score. Comparison of results to determine the most effective algorithm.

simulationResults.description: The simulation results reveal the following accuracy scores for each algorithm...
accuracyScores: K-Nearest Neighbors (K=9): Results comparable to Decision Trees and SVMs.
Sequential Neural Network: Achieved an accuracy of 97-98% after 10 epochs.
parameters: Features: 215 features including permissions, API calls, dynamic behaviors, and intents.
Evaluation Metrics: Accuracy, precision, recall, F1-score.
Software and Tools: Python, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow.

discussion: The results indicate that machine learning algorithms are highly effective in classifying mobile applications as either benign or malware...
conclusion: This research demonstrates the feasibility and effectiveness of using machine learning algorithms for mobile malware detection...
